title: Specific site access
content:
I frequently use the following site: https://qglobal.pearsonassessments.com/qg/ with my Firefox browser. Last night it would not complete the login process. I tried several different accounts, typed in the information rather than using the auto-fill and also cleared the cache. Multiple attempts. No luck. Then I tried using the browser, Edge, and it completed the login. There was a new update to Firefox in the last couple days. Could that be the problem? I contacted the tech support at the Pearson Assessments and they tried it from their computer, on Firefox, and it worked. But their Firefox was not the most updated version.

Thank you.
creator: sadie.jan

title: (German interface) When browsing YouTube, the shortcut in the right-click menu for New Tab and Ton (Audio) are the same
content:
I was using Firefox with German set as my default language. When browsing YouTube and right-clicking a video thumbnail on the homepage, suddenly a lot of new options have been added to the right-click menu related to playing the video, such as 'Pause', 'Unmute', 'Speed' etc.

One of the shortcuts is 'Ton' (German for Audio), which leads to the right-click menu option for 'New Tab' and 'Ton (Audio)' being the same, both are selected using Strg + T. This means that now I cannot simply use Strg + T to open the video in a new tab, I have to tap an additional key to select which of the 'T'-options (New Tab or Ton) I want to choose, since simply using Strg + T will just keep switching between the options in the menu instead of selecting it. It's a small but at the same time incredibly annoying change.

Since this problem doesn't exist when using the English interface, I switched to that as a short term solution. But I would really like to know why this choice was made for the German interface, considering how often the New Tab shortcut will be used and that I don't need those video settings on the homepage at all.

Is there a way to change this or edit the right-click menu? Or could you consider this fact in your next update? Please make the shortcut for 'Ton' something other than Strg + T...
creator: mmammimumemo

title: Can I choose to use Firefox-ESR version 115.6.0 instead of 128.3.0?
content:
My Linux distro is Debian 12.7.0, 64bit, US English.

Can I use firefox-115.16.0esr.tar.bz2 instead of firefox-128.3.0esr.tar.bz2?

There's this statement in Release notes. It says:

Version 115.16.0, first offered to ESR channel users on October 1, 2024" Firefox ESR 115 is now supported only on Windows 7-8.1 and macOS 10.12-10.14. Users on other operating systems should use Firefox ESR 128 instead.

But I am not using Microsoft Windows or macOS as my operating system.

Thanks for your help.

title: Restore Firefox bookmarks
content:
I just installed Firefox on a new device and wanted to set it up to mirrow my Firefox setup on another device. On this other device, I use both Firefox and Chrome, but I keep them separate, so that Chrome is associated with my Google account and Firefox with my work/professional account. When I installed Firefox on my new device, it defaulted to using bookmarks from my Chrome account somehow. Thinking I could inherit the correct bookmarks from Firefox on my old device, I turned on Sync for my new Firefox. But this had the opposite effect: it sent the Chrome bookmarks from my new Firefox to the Firefox on my old device. I even have a third device running Firefox in the same framework as my old device (so, Firefox=professional, Chrome=personal/Google), and this third device also automatically acquired the Chrome bookmarks from the Firefox on my new device.

How do I fix this? How do I recover the Firefox bookmarks (my non-Google Chrome bookmarks)? Thank you!
creator: matthew.morena

title: Problem with the toolbar and bookmarks in the browser
content:
I am using Mozilla Firefox Developers Edition for Windows 11. Recently I have encountered a problem where my bookmarks are constantly disappearing from the panel and toolbar elements are changing places (like the arrows or the reload button).

I read the support and came across three articles about problems with this. The first two were xulstore and Places.sqlite files, which I deleted and followed the instructions in the article, reset the browser settings, but nothing happened. The third article was about the profile, I went in and saw that I had two profiles, which I deleted and created a new one, completely previously removed the browser from the device. But again, nothing happened.

I think this started when I started using the built-in Windows 11 workspace feature (multiple desktops, I opened two browsers at the same time). It was after this that my bookmarks and toolbar changed in the pre-login in the application.

I would appreciate help with this issue.

title: Problems loading Google websites
content: Since a few weeks ago, I have had problems with Firefox "hanging" when trying to access Google sites; this includes typing something into the search window on the address bar. Sometimes, changing the URL from "google.com" to "google.co.uk" or vice versa causes the site to load, but not always, and with Google maps, sometimes the site partially loads - e.g. satellite view and some icons missing. I have never seen this on Firefox with non-Google sites, nor on Chrome/Edge with Google sites. I have tried the other suggestions here, such as disabling anti-virus, clearing proxy (not that I use one anyway) etc, and clearing the DNS and HTTP caches, to no avail. I have no relevant extensions. What is particularly strange is that when a URL is not loading, if I open Chrome and type in that same URL, it will load immediately there and also immediately in Firefox (sometimes needing a refresh). I have seen other reports online of similar issues in recent weeks from other users, which makes me feel that it may be related to a recent Firefox update.

title: Own CA: Self-signed Certificates not longer secure under Firefox Android but still under the Desktop
content:
Hello there,

I'm using an own Certificate Authority in order to create certificates for intranet websites. There's a chain of trust, I always imported the public part of the ca-certificate into the phones "Trusted credentials" store of android. Then it is listed under the Users-Tab. The expected behavior would be, that the Browser now trusts the all the self signed certificates from that CA. This worked many years, however this is not the case any more. Now I get warnings in Firefox under Android, that the intranet sites are not providing a secure connection. (Secure connection failed, Accept the risk and continue)

Using Firefox on an actual desktop pc however works, the certificates are still trusted, the connection is shown as secure.

I wonder what has happened to the Android browser version. Is it a bug or is it a feature?

Btw, googles chrome also doesn't accept the certificate any more, also says insecure connection. And on Desktop, they also work.

I'm not questioning that it works on desktops. Thats's why I made all the effort to set up a local CA, to have a secure connections within my intranet. I just wonder why it doesn't work on mobile phones any more.

Best regards Ben
creator: signed

title: Conflict between Firefox and Thunderbird - FF side
content:
When FF is open and then I open TB, several new windows are created in FF. My default FF window disappears and is not present in the windows history. When I reset my computer, sometimes my default FF window reappears. When I do something in FF, TB immediately closes.

At first I suspected TB and put a question in the TB forum. I downgraded TB from 128.2.3 to 115.10.1 after disabling automatic updates of TB. Initially the problem seemed solved, but not so.

I am surprised the FF and TB seem to influence one another.

Working with FF 130.0.1.

title: Unremovable "List all tabs" Button
content:
I want to get rid of the "List all tabs" button that has appeared in Firefox 131.0! WTF are these cretinous devs thinking in not providing an option to delete this? One of the hallmarks of Firefox has always been customizability. Apparently, the devs need to be reminded of this! I hate this feature with a passion and want it gone NOW! It is a detestable eyesore on my, otherwise, pristine interface which constantly draws my eye and incites anger. Acceptable solutions include making it possible to drag it off the toolbar using the "customize toolbar" feature, allowing users to right click it and click "remove from toolbar", or allowing it to be removed using about:config.

Why would the devs alienate a significant portion of their user base by insisting that this be on the toolbar? Are they so out of touch? The devs need to wake the F up! Many users do not habitually keep a large number of tabs open and do not want or need this feature taking up real estate on the toolbar! Having options is a good thing. Making the "List all tabs" feature available to those who want it is commendable; shoving it down everyone’s throats whether they want it or not is deplorable.
creator: choninhw
